availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Richard C. Ricketts (Woodford County, KY, petitioner)

body.p: Woodford County, Kentucky, minister. Kentucky native. Married to Cornelia Desha Ricketts in Mason County in February 1835. Father of Benjamin P. Ricketts, James P. Ricketts, R. C. Ricketts, Mary P. Ricketts, and Henry C. Ricketts. First full-time minister for the Georgetown Christian Church from October 24, 1835. Minister of Paris Church of Christ c1840. Minister in Boyle County in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Boyle County in 1850. Christian minister in Woodford County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Woodford County in 1860. Member of board of curators for Kentucky University.

ab.bibl:
